title: The Right Way to Position Your Sony PS5

steps.title: Sony claims that either placement is fine.
steps.content: Sony claims that either placement is fine. According to Sony’s official PS5 Quick Start Guide , the official PS5 base can be used to secure the console in either a vertical or horizontal position. [1] X Research source In an interview conducted with Yasuhiro Otori (PlayStation’s Manager of the Mechanical Design Department) before the PS5’s release, Otori explains that the console can be safely placed in a vertical or horizontal orientation without damaging the cooling system. [2] X Research source The cooling system in question is a liquid cooling system that’s attached to the PS5’s Accelerated Process Unit (APU). The liquid metal is corralled in place by a secure, spongey seal that prevents the metal from touching the APU. The APU is an important console part that allows the PS5 to process graphics and video. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Some claim a vertical placement can damage a PS5, but this isn’t proven.
steps.content: Some claim a vertical placement can damage a PS5, but this isn’t proven. In recent years (notably in August 2022 and January 2023), people have claimed (like French repair gurus Ben Montana and 68 Logic) that keeping the PS5 upright allowed for liquid metal in the cooling system to leak out and damage internal parts of the PS5. [4] X Research source The Verdict: All the evidence that condemns the vertical PS5 orientation is anecdotal and not backed or confirmed by Sony. Ultimately, it’s up to you how you choose to set up your PS5 . Plenty of gamers have perfectly intact PS5 consoles that are stored vertically, but it never hurts to be careful. Keep in mind: While Sony offers PS5 warranties, these warranties are voided if you open up and/or alter your PS5 without the help of official repair channels . [5] X Research source If you suspect your PS5 could be damaged, always get a Sony-certified professional to inspect it.

steps.title: Turn the circular base clockwise.
steps.content: Turn the circular base clockwise. Make sure that the raised, rectangular portion is twisted to the right of the hinges so the base can easily attach to the console. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Secure the hinges to the back edge of the PS5.
steps.content: Secure the hinges to the back edge of the PS5. Along the back edge of your console, feel for a series of etched squares, Xs, circles, and triangles. Align the hinges along the squares on either end of the engraving. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Press on the base to secure it in place.
steps.content: Press on the base to secure it in place. Apply enough pressure to the hinges so they firmly clasp onto the back of the console. Set the console base-side-down when you’re confident that the base is firmly attached. [8] X Research source To remove a horizontally-mounted base, give it a firm tug.

steps.title: Take off the plastic cap from the bottom of the console.
steps.content: Take off the plastic cap from the bottom of the console. This plastic cap covers the screw hole that allows the PS5 to be mounted to the base. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Stick the screw cap into the bottom of the base and remove the screw.
steps.content: Stick the screw cap into the bottom of the base and remove the screw. Flip the base over and locate the screw compartment. In this area is a circular opening—this is where the screw cap needs to go. Pull out the screw with your fingers and set it aside. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Set the PS5 sideways and arrange the base along the bottom.
steps.content: Set the PS5 sideways and arrange the base along the bottom. Flip the console so it’s sitting on its narrow, more tapered edge. The exposed screw hole should be aligned vertically and facing you. Then, line up the central screw hole on the base with the exposed screw hole on the console—the base’s hinges should naturally tuck into the wider end of the PS5. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Secure the screw with a coin to finish mounting the base.
steps.content: Secure the screw with a coin to finish mounting the base. Slip the screw through the base and into the opening along the console. Using a coin or a flathead screwdriver, carefully tighten the screw in place to secure your PS5. It’s now ready to be placed base-side-down in your gaming area! [12] X Research source To detach the mounted base, simply undo the screw and tuck it back into the bottom of the base. Put the screw cover back in its original position.
